benchmark_details.name: I am a Strange Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: A new dataset for assessing language models' capabilities in handling metalinguistic self-reference through generation and verification tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the capacity of models to generate and understand self-referential statements and prerequisite metalinguistic reasoning.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset challenges even the best current language models, with many performing close to chance.

data.source: Hand-crafted by experts and validated by non-expert annotators.
data.annotation: Handcrafted by experts and validated through agreement rates with non-expert annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are based on the loss assigned to continuations by the models.
methodology.interpretation: Lower loss for true statements indicates correct understanding.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT 4 is the only model consistently performing above chance.
methodology.validation: Models judged statements as true or false through prompts designed for zero-shot and few-shot evaluations.
